_header: Little and mickle old and young / Listeneth now…

CULFf238.First Lines:
Lytyll & mykyll olde & yongeLystenyth now to my
                    talkynge…
CULFf238.Last Lines: …Graunt vs all thy blessyngAnd yn heuynto a byde

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Mekyll and littill olde & ȝyngeherkyns all to my
                    talkynge…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu lorde of heuene kyngeThou gyffe vs alle thi dere
                    blyssyngeAmen Amen par charyte Amen
Lincoln91.Note:
1628 lines; a leaf wanting between ff. 102, 103; half of f. 108 torn
                    away.
Lincoln91.Attributed Title: here By gynnes The Romance off Octovyane (f. 98v)
